stalk.translation[0].definitions[0].defi: a long narrow part of a plant that supports leaves, fruits, or flowers
stalk.translation[1].definitions[0].defi: to follow a person or animal quietly in order to catch and attack or kill them
stalk.translation[1].definitions[0].exam: We know the rapist stalks his victims at night.
stalk.translation[1].definitions[1].defi: to follow and watch someone over a long period of time in a way that is very annoying or threatening, and that is considered a crime in some places
stalk.translation[1].definitions[1].exam: She was stalked by an obsessed fan.
stalk.translation[1].definitions[2].defi: to walk in a proud or angry way, with long steps
stalk.translation[1].definitions[2].exam: Yvonne turned and stalked out of the room in disgust.
stalk.translation[1].definitions[3].defi: if something bad stalks a place, you see or feel it everywhere in that place
stalk.translation[1].definitions[3].exam: Fear stalks every dark stairwell and walkway.
